did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Henry F. Bedfore Collection of Textile Related Photographs, 1912
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Photographs from the March 14, 1912, Lawrence, Massachusetts, textile strike.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Photographs showing the end of the March 14, 1912, Lawrence, Massachusetts, textile strike, Big Bill Haywood speaking, strikers' children returning to Lawrence, and Decoration Day (Memorial Day).

did.unittitle: Various photos after strike: parades, meeting on common, Decoration Day
Item 1: Mass meeting, Lawrence Common, calling off strike

scopecontent.p: March 14, 1912. Snapshot gelatin silver print. Image depicts a meeting on Lawrence Common, Lawrence, Mass., where the textile strike was called off. View shows men, women and children standing on Common, listening to IWW leader speaking from grandstand. Written on reverse: Mass Meeting Common March 14, 1912 Calling off strike." 12.75 x 9.75 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 2: Leading the parade when children came home

scopecontent.p: Snapshot gelatin silver print, [1912]. Image depicts two little girls, holding flower baskets, leading a group of Ayer Mill Spinning Room workers in the parade celebrating the return of children of strikers who had been removed from Lawrence, Mass., during the textile strike of 1912. Written on reverse: "Leading the parade when kiddies came home." 12.75 x 9.75 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 3: At railroad station waiting for children to come home

scopecontent.p: Snapshot gelatin silver print, [1912]. Image depicts crowd at B&M (Boston & Maine) railroad station, waiting for the return of children of strikers who had been removed from Lawrence, Mass., during the textile strike of 1912. Written on reverse: "At B & M. station waiting for kiddies to come home." 13 x 9.75 cm.

Snapshot gelatin silver print. Image depicts parade through Lawrence, Mass., on Decoration Day (now known as Memorial Day) in 1912, two months after textile strike was over. Written on reverse: "I.W.W. parade Decoration Day 1912." 13 x 9.75 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 5: Parade for children coming home

scopecontent.p: Snapshot gelatin silver print. Image depicts parade through Lawrence, Mass., when children of strikers who had been removed from Lawrence during the textile strike returned home. Visible are crowds of onlookers; several horse-drawn wagons containing children; band. Written on reverse: "When "kiddies" came home." 13 x 9.75 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 6: Leaving mass meeting on Lawrence Common

scopecontent.p: March 14, 1912. Snapshot gelatin silver print. Image depicts people leaving the mass meeting on Lawrence Common, Lawrence, Mass., on March 14, 1912, after the textile strike was declared off. Written on reverse: "Leaving Mass Meeting Common March 14, 1912 Strike declared off." 12.75 x 9.75 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 7: Grave of Ramy, Decoration Day 1912

scopecontent.p: Snapshot gelatin silver prin. Image depicts large crowd at grave of boy apparently killed [?] or who died during textile strike, with several people laying wreaths. Decoration Day now known as Memorial Day. Written on reverse: "Grave of Ramy (?) boy Decoration Day 1912." 12.75 x 9.75 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 8: Grave of Annie LoPizzo, Decoration Day 1912

scopecontent.p: Snapshot gelatin silver print. Image depicts a crowd of people laying a wreath on the grave of Anna LoPizzo (name variously spelled as: LoPezza, Lopezza, Lopezzo) on Decoration Day (now known as Memorial Day). LoPizzo was shot and killed on January 29, 1912 while protesting during the textile strike in Lawrence, Mass. Written on reverse: "Grave of Annie La Piza? Decoration Day 1912." 12.75 x 9.75 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 9: Big Bill Haywood on Lawrence Common

scopecontent.p: March 14, 1912. Snapshot gelatin silver print. Image depicts William "Big Bill" Haywood of the I.W.W. speaking on Lawrence Common, Lawrence, Mass., March 14, 1912, when the textile strike was called off. Written on reverse: " 'Big Bill' in action March 14, 1912." 13 x 9.75 cm.
